stem: In a patient with vasculitic peripheral neuropathy, weakness in plantarflexion and loss of the ankle jerk most strongly suggest involvement of which nerve?
rationale_correct: The tibial nerve innervates the posterior compartment (gastrocnemius–soleus); lesions reduce plantarflexion and Achilles reflex.

rationale_distractors.B: Deep fibular lesions cause dorsiflexion weakness and first web space sensory loss.
rationale_distractors.C: Superficial fibular lesions impair eversion and dorsum foot sensation, not plantarflexion or Achilles reflex.
rationale_distractors.D: Femoral nerve affects knee extension, not ankle plantarflexion.
rationale_distractors.E: Sural nerve is sensory only (posterolateral leg/foot).

evidence.citation: Anderson A. CIL – Multisystem autoimmune diseases. Dec 11, 2024.
